page.title: 04RELIGION
page.content: There was one Church in Low Hesket. The population of Low Hesket is about 50 - 60. There is only one evening service a month. The vicarage is at High Hesket. The Church centres around three other towns, which are Armathwaite "Christ and St. Mary", Hesket in the Forest "St. Mary the Virgin.", and Calthwaite. Most people's family went to Church. The average Church goer's to High Hesket and Low Hesket was between 20 - 30. The older generation benefit more at High Hesket. Most people took communion and were baptised. The church held fund raising coffee mornings and wine and cheese afternoons. There was also a Mothers Union, barbeque's and Flower competitions. Protestant community is about 25 _ 30.
